response:
A relapsing–remitting demyelinating disorder best explains multifocal CNS signs in a 41-year-old. However, a pupil-involving third-nerve palsy is a neurosurgical emergency (posterior communicating artery aneurysm) that must be excluded urgently. Other inflammatory and granulomatous causes can mimic this distribution.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis (relapsing\u2013remitting)", "Posterior Communicating Artery Aneurysm causing left CN III palsy", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder", "MOG Antibody\u2013Associated Disease", "Orbital Apex/Cavernous Sinus Syndrome (e.g., Tolosa\u2013Hunt, cavernous sinus thrombosis)", "Neurosarcoidosis", "Primary CNS Vasculitis (including SLE/ANCA-associated)", "Degenerative Cervical Myelopathy"]
